abstract: Federal Judge Alison J Nathan declines to send retired New York Police Officer Joseph P Dwyer to prison for his role, while acting as private investigator, in attaining access to restricted FBI database; citing Dwyer's history of public service on police force and integrity as private defense investigator, Nathan sentences him to five years of probation.
lead_paragraph: Joseph P. Dwyer, who became a private investigator after retiring, was given probation after he paid a sergeant to tap into the confidential system to aid his clients.

headline.main: Ex-New York Officer Spared Prison Time for Misusing Restricted Database
headline.print_headline: Former Officer Turned Private Investigator  Avoids Prison for Misusing Police Database

snippet: Joseph P. Dwyer, who became a private investigator after retiring, was given probation after he paid a sergeant to tap into the confidential system to aid his clients.
